results.title: Wall Street, CP-B37 Reel Six Vitaphone record
results.brief_description: Vitaphone was a sound film system used for feature films and nearly 1,000 short subjects made by Warner Bros. and its sister studio First National from 1926 to 1931. Vitaphone was the last major analog sound-on-disc system and the only one which was widely used and commercially successful.

results.title: Fiona Hall. After 200 years
results.creator_credit: Kevin Ballantine, Brian Beaton and Izon Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Visual instincts : Australian contemporary photographers”.
Two 30 minute episodes: 1. “Fiona Hall” Interview with Adelaide photographic artist, Fiona Hall. She discusses the aims and symbolism of her photo-collages and wide format photography. 2. “After 200 Years” A program on the Bicentennial project, co-ordinated by Penny Taylor, to commission twenty Australian photographers to document the diversity of Australian Aboriginal and Islander lifestyles in the ‘80s.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kevin Ballantine, Brian Beaton and Izon Productions

results.title: Grant Mudford. Max Pam
results.creator_credit: Roger Young, Jeff Atkinson, Kevin Ballantine, Brian Beaton and Izon Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Visual instincts : Australian contemporary photographers”.
Two thirty minute programs: 1. “Grant Mudford” Born in Australia in 1944, photographer, Grant Mudford, now lives and works in California. He prefers anonymous architectural subject matter photographed in a manner that transforms it. 2. “Max Pam” Born in Melbourne, Max Pam left at age 19 for Katmandu. He returned to Australia in 1984 having established an international reputation as a photographer of Asia. Photography, for Pam, has the capacity to capture certain moments which elude the writer, the filmmaker or the painter.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Roger Young, Jeff Atkinson, Kevin Ballantine, Brian Beaton and Izon Productions

results.title: Emmanuel Angelicas & Jon Lewis
results.creator_credit: Kevin Ballantine, Brian Beaton and Izon Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Visual instincts : Australian contemporary photographers”.
Two half hour episodes: 1. Marrickville photographer, Emmanuel Angelicas, talks on the sources and themes of his photography - sex, violence, television and religion. He enforces his style through his sense of composition, Greek tradition and a particular detachment from his surroundings. 2. Jon Lewis, Sydney photographer, is a paparazzi with a human face. It is his scrutiny of the bright lights and big city of Sydney that singles him out as an outstanding chronicler of public Australia.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kevin Ballantine, Brian Beaton and Izon Productions

results.title: Battle for Warsaw
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Visions of War”.
This new documentary special traces the tragic story of the 1944 Warsaw uprising in which nearly a quarter of a million Poles lost their lives. It includes much archive material that is rare, and that has only recently come to light; as well as remarkable eye-witness accounts from some of the principals. Rated: PG
